intro: Conyza schimperi, commonly known as the African ironweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Conyza schimperi is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize areas quickly, making it both a weed and a potential forage plant.
